short_summary: Replace damaged pedestrian bridge at Jake's Landing in Kejimkujik National Park
description: The former floating bridge that spanned the Mersey River at Jake’s Landing in Kejimkujik National Park and National Historic Site was damaged beyond repair during Hurricane Fiona. The floating bridge was an important pedestrian bridge that connected the campground and Jake’s Landing. The objective of this project is to replace the former floating bridge with a permanent bridge structure on the same horizontal alignment. The new structure will be comprised of a composite fiber technology (CFT) superstructure, in line with the Federal Government and Park’s Canada broader goal of sustainable development, and a combination of deep and shallow foundation(s) substructure.
full_summary:
### Stage 2: Construction of Jake’s Landing Pedestrian Bridge at Kejimkujik National Park and National Historic Site

### Solicitation Number and Status
Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0150/A-001
Status: Expired

### Project Overview
Following significant damage sustained by the floating bridge at Jake’s Landing during Hurricane Fiona, Parks Canada invites contractors to tender for the construction of a permanent pedestrian bridge. The new structure will be comprised of a composite fiber technology (CFT) superstructure, supporting the Federal Government and Parks Canada’s commitment to sustainable development. The bridge will feature a Three-Span CFT Bridge structure with three truss spans.

### Tender Process
This is the second stage of a two-stage solicitation process. The first stage evaluated the qualifications of all interested suppliers, and qualified suppliers have been invited to provide a financial proposal based on the specifications and drawings. Only qualified suppliers may participate in the tender process.

### Technical Specifications
* Offsite construction service
* Bridge construction and repair service
* Land pre-construction assessment service

### Service Location
Located in Nova Scotia, Canada, with potential for regional delivery across Canada

### Tender Closing Date
2023-10-12T15:00:00

### Contracting Entity
Parks Canada
Address: 3 Passage du Chien d’Or
City: Québec
Province: QC
Postal Code: G1R 3Z8
Country: Canada
Contact Information: Annik Piché
Email: annik.piche@pc.gc.ca
Phone: (581) 398-3489

### Trade Agreements and Regions
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Regions of opportunity: Canada
* Regions of delivery: Nova Scotia and Canada
